synopsis: In episode #9, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome guest Vivek Menon, who shares his inspiring journey of filmmaking alongside his father. They delve into the challenges and joys of creating their series 'New Normal,' while discussing the importance of self-expression and the evolving landscape of South Asian representation in media.
quotes: You can't really open up and talk about my feelings unless I'm on a podcast.
If you spend so much time making something, you can't even watch it with people who are supporting you—that’s ridiculous.
Success isn't just about making it big; it's about continually telling the stories you want to tell.
Your experience and voice are the most unique things you can write.
Sometimes you have to remind yourself that the best way to learn is by doing.
It's okay to have different ideas of what's funny based on generational differences.
If there's something that has been on the back of your mind, just throw yourself into it and see what happens.
Passion isn't something you have; it's something that develops through practice.
You will definitely learn something about yourself, even if it's that you don't want to do this again.
The best film school is just doing, making stuff.
